item.title: Deep Learning Skin Cancer Detection (Multi-Type, ISIC2018)
item.description:
Project Overview

This project leverages state-of-the-art deep learning techniques to classify multiple types of skin lesions from the ISIC2018 dataset. The model is trained to detect and categorize skin cancer types accurately, with a focus on robustness and real-world applicability.

Features

  • Multi-class skin lesion classification
  • Data augmentation and preprocessing for improved generalization
  • Model evaluation with precision, recall, and F1-score
  • User-friendly visualization of predictions

Installation & Usage

Check the for code, installation instructions, and examples.

Visualization

This preview shows the deep learning model detecting and classifying skin lesions, highlighting the AI-powered approach.

item.title: An extensive investigation into the use of machine learning tools and deep neural networks for the recognition of skin cancer: challenges, future directions, and a comprehensive review
